data.title: Ethereum News: ETH Price Slides 5.5% Below $3,800 Amid ETF Outflows and Technical Breakdown
data.description: Key TakeawaysEthereum (ETH) price slid 5.50% in 24h to below $3,800, underperforming the broader crypto market (-4.29%).Rejection at $4,200 resistance triggered $210M in long liquidations within 24 hoursETH ETFs saw $81.4M in outflows on October 29, led by Fidelity’s FETH ETF (-$69.5M) ETH Price Today: Sellers Regain Control Below $3,800Ethereum fell sharply on Thursday, dropping 5.16% to $3,818.34, extending its weekly decline as investors reacted to ETF outflows, macro headwinds, and a failed breakout attempt above the key $4,200 resistance zone.The sell-off came amid a broader crypto pullback following hawkish remarks from the U.S. Federal Reserve, while on-chain data showed declining futures demand and slower network activity. Technical Rejection Triggers LiquidationsETH’s latest decline followed a sharp rejection near $4,200—a major resistance level that coincides with the 50-day SMA and Fibonacci 61.8% retracement zone.Trading volume surged above $40 billion, confirming distribution as the price fell toward $3,800.Implications for ETH:$210 million in ETH long positions were liquidated in 24 hours, according to Crypto.news, signaling forced deleveraging.ETH’s breakdown below the 30-day SMA ($4,127) and momentum indicators turning negative reinforce short-term bearish bias.The next critical support lies near the 200-day EMA ($3,622), while a close below $3,737 (Fibonacci 78.6%) could accelerate losses toward the $3,500–$3,350 zone.Technical snapshot:RSI (14): 41.0, neutral but weakeningMomentum (10): -181.3, bearish signalMACD (12,26): -77.2 – Mild bullish crossover, but fadingEMA(10): $3,950.20 and EMA(200): $3,600.40, Short-term momentum remains below trend structureSource: TradingViewInstitutional Pullback: ETF Outflows Undermine ConfidenceEthereum ETFs recorded $81.4 million in outflows on October 29, while Bitcoin funds lost $470 million, according to CoinTribune.Fidelity’s FETH ETF led redemptions with $69.5 million withdrawn, underscoring cautious sentiment among institutional traders.Implications for ETH:Risk rotation: Traditional finance investors pared crypto exposure amid macro uncertainty and diverging Fed signals.Yield mismatch: ETH’s 7% staking yield has not been enough to offset the broader risk-off tone. Altcoin Weakness Adds Downside MomentumEthereum’s 5.16% drop outpaced Bitcoin’s 4.29% decline, as the Altcoin Season Index plunged 48% in October to 29, highlighting the market’s shift away from high-beta assets.Market context:ETH’s 1.1 beta to BTC means downside moves are amplified during risk aversion phases.Solana’s ETF debut drew speculative flows away from ETH, though Ethereum still processes 3.7 million daily transactions, 3.5x Solana’s throughput.This relative underperformance reflects rotation dynamics rather than structural weakness, but traders remain cautious until ETH reclaims the $4,000 handle. Macro Factors: Fed Policy Adds ComplexityThe October 28–29 FOMC meeting brought a 25-basis-point rate cut, lowering the federal funds rate to 3.75%–4.00% — the second consecutive cut.However, Fed Chair Jerome Powell’s cautious tone emphasized data dependency, cooling the initial optimism in risk assets.While inflation has eased to around 3.0% YoY, the federal government shutdown has disrupted economic data flow, leaving policymakers “flying blind,” as Powell described. Outlook: Can ETH Hold $3,737?Short-term technicals point to a fragile support zone between $3,737 and $3,622.Losing this range could open downside targets at $3,500 and $3,350, while reclaiming $4,000 would reestablish bullish momentum toward $4,200–$4,500.Bullish recovery scenario: ETH stabilizes above the 200-day EMA and benefits from renewed ETF inflows post-Fed meeting, potentially targeting $4,500 by late Q4.Bearish continuation: Failure to hold the $3,737–$3,622 zone could extend losses toward $3,350, confirming a deeper correction phase.

data.title: Decentralized physical oracle project Nubila announces NB token economic model: total supply of 1 billion tokens, 41% allocated to mining incentives.
data.description: Nubila, a decentralized physical oracle project, has officially announced its token economic model. The platform's native token, NB, has a total supply of 1 billion, distributed as follows: Device Mining Pool: 21% (210 million NB), 5% unlocked upon TGE, the remainder released linearly over 60 months; Node Mining Pool: 20% (200 million NB), 5% unlocked upon TGE, the remainder released linearly over 60 months; Pre-Seed Round: 6.25% (62.5 million NB), 12-month lock-up period followed by 36-month linear release; Seed Round: 8% (80 million NB), 12-month lock-up period followed by 24-month linear release; POS Incentives: 6.5% (65 million NB), 25% unlocked upon TGE, the remainder released linearly over 5 years; Foundation and Treasury: 6.5% (65 million NB), 40% unlocked upon TGE, the remainder released linearly over 12 months; Team: 12% (120 million NB), 12-month lock-up period followed by 36-month linear release. The rewards are distributed as follows: 1. Linear release over 12 months; 2. Advisors: 2% (20 million tokens), with a 12-month lock-up period followed by linear release over 36 months; Liquidity and Market Making: 2.25% (22.5 million tokens), fully unlocked at TGE; Community Airdrop: 7.5% (75 million tokens), with 25% unlocked at TGE, another 25% unlocked in T+3 months, and the entire amount released in T+6 months; Exchange Airdrop and Marketing: 8% (80 million tokens), fully unlocked at TGE. The official statement indicates that NB is the core asset of the Nubila ecosystem, used for data access, device and node incentives, staking verification, governance voting, and developer tools and API payments.

data.title: Market Downturn Leads to Partial Liquidation of Key Positions
data.description: According to Odaily, Onchain Lens monitoring has revealed that amid a market downturn, significant long positions held by Machi Big Brother in ETH, HYPE, and PUMP have been partially liquidated. Currently, the ETH long position has incurred a loss of $470,000.

data.title: Binance Alpha to Feature Kite (KITE)
data.description: Binance announced on X that Binance Alpha will be the first platform to feature Kite (KITE) on November 3, 2025.Eligible users can claim their airdrop using Binance Alpha Points on the Alpha Events page once trading opens. Further details will be announced soon.

data.title: Mastercard reports $8.6 billion in Q3 net revenue, up 17% year‑over‑year
data.description:
Mastercard on Thursday reported that it recorded $8. 6 billion in net revenue last quarter, up by 17% from the same quarter last year, according to the company’s earnings report. The payments giant said the growth came from strong card spending across consumers and businesses, along with expanded services beyond payments. Net income reached $3. 9 billion, […]
source: https://www.cryptopolitan.com/mastercard-reports-8-6-billion-in-q3/

data.title: The "whale" with a 100% win rate since October 11th has accumulated over $11.46 million in unrealized losses on its long positions in BTC, ETH, and SOL.
data.description: Hyperbot data shows that the "100% win rate whale since 10.11" has suffered a total unrealized loss of over $11.46 million on its long positions in BTC, ETH, and SOL, specifically: $2.33 million on BTC long positions; $2.16 million on ETH long positions; and $6.97 million on SOL long positions.

data.title: Machi Big Brother's long positions in ETH, HYPE, and PUMP were partially liquidated.
data.description: According to Onchain Lens monitoring, during the market downturn, Machi Big Brother's long positions in ETH, HYPE, and PUMP were partially liquidated, and his ETH long positions are currently down $470,000.

data.title: Bitcoin(BTC) Drops Below 108,000 USDT with a 4.65% Decrease in 24 Hours
data.description: On Oct 30, 2025, 13:39 PM(UTC). According to Binance Market Data, Bitcoin has dropped below 108,000 USDT and is now trading at 107,762.15625 USDT, with a narrowed 4.65% decrease in 24 hours.

data.title: Garden Finance Faces Multi-Chain Theft of Over $5.5 Million
data.description: According to Odaily, Garden Finance has reportedly been targeted in a theft involving more than $5.5 million across multiple blockchain networks. An address linked to the Garden Finance team has communicated with the suspected attacker, offering a 10% white hat bounty. However, the team has yet to make a public statement regarding the incident. The address associated with the stolen funds is 0x98BCc6c34A489CEfdD9DfA8d792CFEFb02Ea2D12.

data.title: In the past hour, $157 million in positions were liquidated across the entire network, mainly long positions.
data.description: According to Coinglass data, $157 million in positions were liquidated across the network in the past hour, with $155 million in long positions and $2.348 million in short positions.

data.title: Canaan Inc. Secures Major Contract for Bitcoin Mining in Japan
data.description:
According to Odaily, Canaan Inc. has announced a significant contract in Japan, involving the deployment of its Avalon water-cooled Bitcoin mining machines. The contract, valued at 4.5MW, aims to facilitate real-time grid balancing and energy optimization.

The initiative is led by a major regional utility company, which plans to utilize Canaan's intelligent control chips to dynamically adjust voltage, frequency, and computing power. This approach is designed to stabilize the grid and enhance efficiency. The project is expected to be completed by the end of 2025.

data.title: Canaan Technology announced that it has signed a 4.5MW contract in Japan to deploy its Avalon water-cooled Bitcoin mining machines.
data.description: Bitcoin News reported on the X platform that Canaan Inc. announced a 4.5MW contract in Japan to deploy its Avalon water-cooled Bitcoin mining rigs for real-time grid balancing and energy optimization. Led by a large regional utility, the facility will use Canaan's smart control chips to dynamically adjust voltage, frequency, and hashrate to help stabilize the grid and improve efficiency. Completion is expected by the end of 2025.

data.description: U.S. stocks opened lower, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average down 0.5%, the S&P 500 down 0.5%, and the Nasdaq Composite down 0.7%. (Jinshi)

data.title: Zcash (ZEC) Needs 2,600% to Pass XRP: 'Easy,' Says Top Solana Developer
data.description:
Privacy coin Zcash (ZEC) trades at just $359, with a $5. 8 billion cap, but Solana's Mert insists a 2,600% run to flip XRP's $152 billion throne is not just possible but easy.

data.title: A major whale's long positions in BTC, Trump, and ENA were liquidated three times within half an hour, turning a profit of $4 million into a loss of $238,000.
data.description: According to Lookonchain monitoring, due to the market decline, the highly leveraged whale "0xf35a6" had its long positions in BTC, Trump, and ENA liquidated three times within 30 minutes. The whale's unrealized profit of over $4 million has now turned into an unrealized loss of $238,000.

data.title: European Central Bank Maintains Deposit Rate at 2% Amid Market Expectations
data.description: According to PANews, the European Central Bank (ECB) has decided to keep the deposit facility rate unchanged at 2%, aligning with market expectations. This marks the third consecutive meeting where the ECB has opted not to alter the rate. Additionally, the main refinancing rate and the marginal lending rate remain steady at 2.15% and 2.40%, respectively.

data.title: Without Bitcoin, what happens to Ether and XRP?
data.description:
What if Bitcoin crashes? Will Ether and XRP fall with it or hold their ground? Discover how a BTC slump could rattle the entire crypto market.
source: https://cointelegraph.com/news/without-bitcoin-what-happens-to-ether-and-xrp?utm_source=rss_feed&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=rss_partner_inbound
